item.description:
We'll be meeting at Mt Tremont Trail Trailhead on RT302, Bartlett, NH at 8AM for car spotting.   This is the ending point  and we'll drive from there to our starting point, which is the intersection of Rob Brook Rd & Bear Notch Rd.   

As Rob Brook Trail will probably be flooded by Rob Brook, we'll be  hiking on Rob Brook Road for 2.6 miles to the Brunel Trail and go north about 1.9 miles.

Then, 0.2 miles to reach to Owls Cliff (2940 ft) and come back 0.2 mile.  Continue hiking 0.8 miles to reach Mt Tremont summit (3371 ft). We will descend 2.8 miles from this point to Rt.302 where we car spotted.   In total, it'll be a 8.5 miles traverse  Hopefully we'll have nice views from both summits including a view of "the Captain" a minature Half Dome. 

These trails are not well traveled so we don't know the trail conditions. We might  be using microspikes or snowshoes  

 

 

 Note:  In the higher elevations, it could be still winter.  Please make sure to wear appropriate foot gear and clothing depending on the weather. No cotton

 

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: Blue Subaru Outback with bike racks on the roof
item.name: Mt Tremont (3371 ft) &Owls Cliff (2940 ft) Hike
